snippet: A Turkish parliamentary commission voted Monday against prosecuting four former cabinet ministers on corruption charges, effectively backing President Recep Tayyip Erdogan after a scandal rattled his inner circle.
abstract: Turkish parliamentary commission effectively backs Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan by voting not to prosecute four former cabinet ministers on corruption charges; Erdogan's inner circle had been rattled by corruption scandal in 2013, one he called fabrication of his political opponents.
lead_paragraph: A Turkish parliamentary commission voted Monday against prosecuting four former cabinet ministers on corruption charges, effectively backing President Recep Tayyip Erdogan after a scandal rattled his inner circle.
